fields.name: timeoutInMillis
fields.description:
The socket reading timeout value to be used in 
                    milliseconds. If this is not set,the default value of
                    300000 milliseconds (5 minutes) will be used.

records.name: ClientConfig
records.description: Configurations for the connectionless UDP client.

fields.name: timeoutInMillis
fields.description:
The socket reading timeout value to be used 
                    in milliseconds. If this is not set,the default value
                    of 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes) will be used.

records.name: ConnectClientConfig
records.description: Configurations for the connection oriented udp client.

fields.name: remoteHost
fields.description: The hostname or the IP address of the remote host

fields.name: remotePort
fields.description: The port number of the remote host

fields.name: data
fields.description: The content which needs to be transported to the remote host

records.name: Datagram
records.description:
A self-contained, independent entity of data carrying sufficient information
to be routed from the source to the destination nodes without reliance
on earlier exchanges between the nodes and the transporting network.

fields.name: remoteHost
fields.description: The hostname or the IP address of the remote host.

fields.name: remotePort
fields.description:
The remote host's port number. if this is not set the server
               runs without connecting to a remote host.

fields.name: localHost
fields.description: The interface for the server to be bound.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data need to be sent to the remote host

returnParameters.description: () or else a `udp:Error` if the given data can't be sent

remoteMethods.name: sendBytes
remoteMethods.description: Sends the response as byte[] to the same remote host.

parameters.name: datagram
parameters.description:
Contains the data to be sent to the remote host
             and the address of the remote host

returnParameters.description: () or else a `udp:Error` if the given data can't be sent

remoteMethods.name: sendDatagram
remoteMethods.description:
Sends the response as datagram to a remote destination as
specified in datagram.

clients.name: Caller
clients.description: Represents caller object in UDP service remote methods.

parameters.name: datagram
parameters.description:
Contains the data to be sent to the remote host
             and the address of the remote host

returnParameters.description: () or else a `udp:Error` if the given data can't be sent

remoteMethods.name: sendDatagram
remoteMethods.description:
Sends the given data to the specified remote host.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? result = socketClient->sendDatagram({remoteHost: "localhost",
    #            remotePort: 48826, data:"msg".toBytes()});
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The udp:Datagram, or else a `udp:Error` if the data 
           can't be read from the remote host

remoteMethods.name: receiveDatagram
remoteMethods.description:
Reads data from the remote host. 
```ballerina
    # udp:Datagram|udp:Error result = socketClient->receiveDatagram();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A `udp:Error` if it can't close the connection or else `()`

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Free up the occupied socket.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? closeResult = socketClient->close();
    # ```

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initializes the UDP connectionless client based on the provided 
configurations.
```ballerina
    # udp:Client|udp:Error? socketClient = new(localHost = "localhost");
    # ```

parameters.description:

             and the address of the remote host

```ballerina

    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The udp:Datagram, or else a `udp:Error` if the data 
           can't be read from the remote host

    # ```

    # ```

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data need to be sent to the connected remote host

returnParameters.description: () or else a `udp:Error` if the given data can't be sent

remoteMethods.name: writeBytes
remoteMethods.description:
Sends the given data to the connected remote host.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? result = socketClient->writeBytes("msg".toBytes());
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The byte[], or else a `udp:Error` if the data
           can't be read from the remote host

remoteMethods.name: readBytes
remoteMethods.description:
Reads data only from the connected remote host. 
```ballerina
    # udp:Datagram|udp:Error result = socketClient->receiveDatagram();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A `udp:Error` if it can't close the connection or else `()`

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Free up the occupied socket.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? closeResult = socketClient->close();
    # ```

parameters.name: remoteHost
parameters.description: The hostname or the IP address of the remote host

parameters.name: remotePort
parameters.description: The port number of the remmote host

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initializes the UDP connect client based on the 
provided configurations.
```ballerina
    # udp:ConnectClient|udp:Error? socketClient = new("www.remote.com", 80,
    #                              localHost = "localHost");
    # ```

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data need to be sent to the connected remote host

returnParameters.description: () or else a `udp:Error` if the given data can't be sent

methods.name: writeBytes
methods.description:
Sends the given data to the connected remote host.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? result = socketClient->writeBytes("msg".toBytes());
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The byte[], or else a `udp:Error` if the data
           can't be read from the remote host

methods.name: readBytes
methods.description:
Reads data only from the connected remote host. 
```ballerina
    # udp:Datagram|udp:Error result = socketClient->receiveDatagram();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A `udp:Error` if it can't close the connection or else `()`

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Free up the occupied socket.
```ballerina
    # udp:Error? closeResult = socketClient->close();
    # ```

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else a `udp:Error` upon failure to register
            the listener

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description:
Binds a service to the `udp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # udp:error? result = udpListener.attach(helloService);
    # ```

parameters.name: localPort
parameters.description: The port number of the remote service

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initializes the UDP listener based on the privovided configurations. 
```ballerina
    #  listener Listener|error? server1 = new (8080);
    # ```

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service

returnParameters.description:
`()` or else a `udp:Error` upon failure to register
            the listener

methods.name: attach
methods.description:
Binds a service to the `udp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # udp:error? result = udpListener.attach(helloService);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if an error occurred during the listener 
           starting process

An `error` if an error occurred during the listener
           stopping process

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the service listener gracefully. Already-accepted requests will be
served before connection closure.

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if an error occurred during the listener
           stop process

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener immediately. It is not implemented yet.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Type descriptor of the service

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `udp:Error` upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `udp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # udp:error? result = udpListener.detach(helloService);
    # ```

parameters.name: localPort
parameters.description: The port number of the remote service

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description:
Initializes the UDP listener based on the privovided configurations. 
```ballerina
    #  listener Listener|error? server1 = new (8080);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if an error occurred during the listener 
           starting process

An `error` if an error occurred during the listener
           stopping process

served before connection closure.

otherMethods.name: detach

```ballerina

    # ```

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
This is used for creating UDP server endpoints. A UDP server endpoint
is capable of responding to remote callers. The `Listener` is responsible
for initializing the endpoint using the provided configurations.

errors.name: GenericError
errors.description: Represents generic socket error, which contains the information related to the error.

errors.name: ReadTimedOutError
errors.description: This will returns once the given read timed out time exceed for socket reads.

packages.name: udp
packages.summary: This package provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) for connectionless protocols.
